summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a BOP employee (EMPLOYEE 4) regarding his activities and observations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9, 2019, the night Jeffrey Epstein died. The employee describes his shift, overtime in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), interactions with other officers, and the procedures around feeding and checking on inmates, including Epstein.

persons.name: EMPLOYEE 4
persons.context: A BOP employee interviewed about his shift on August 9, 2019. He worked the 8am-4pm shift in the warehouse/commissary and then overtime in the SHU, where he helped with feeding and commissary distribution.

persons.name: CHIMMINGS
persons.context: An officer who possibly showed EMPLOYEE 4 how to do commissary distribution in the SHU during the morning/afternoon shift on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: DAVIS
persons.context: An officer working in the SHU who conducted the 4pm count on August 9, 2019. He left the SHU between 9:55pm and 10:00pm that night.

persons.name: NOEL
persons.context: An officer working in the SHU who conducted the 4pm count and helped with the feed on August 9, 2019. EMPLOYEE 4 helped NOEL with the feed and stated NOEL would have had the grill key to the tiers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate in cell L-Tier of the SHU. EMPLOYEE 4 delivered food to him and discussed procedures for checking on him. Epstein is the central figure whose death is under investigation.

connections.description: EMPLOYEE 4 helped NOEL with the inmate feed in the SHU and discussed shift procedures and key responsibilities with him.
Both were present in the SHU during the overtime shift. EMPLOYEE 4 noted when DAVIS left and discussed count procedures with him.
NOEL was an officer responsible for the SHU tier where Epstein was held and would have had the key to access his tier.
EMPLOYEE 4 delivered food to Epstein's cell on the night of August 9, 2019, spending no more than 60 seconds there.

events.title: EMPLOYEE 4's Shift and Epstein's Incarceration
events.description: EMPLOYEE 4 worked his regular 8am-4pm shift in the warehouse/commissary and then overtime in the SHU from approximately 4:15pm to 11:50pm. During this time, he helped with feeding inmates, including Epstein, and discussed procedures and observations with other officers.

events.title: FBI Interview of EMPLOYEE 4
events.description: EMPLOYEE 4 was interviewed by the FBI and OIG at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding his activities and observations on August 9, 2019, at MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: EMPLOYEE 4 was in the SHU on overtime on the night of August 9, 2019, and delivered food to Jeffrey Epstein's cell, spending no more than 60 seconds there.
Officers DAVIS and NOEL conducted the 4pm count in the SHU. DAVIS left between 9:55pm and 10:00pm.
EMPLOYEE 4 stated it is against MCC policy for an officer to go down the tiers alone without another officer assisting.
EMPLOYEE 4 did not recall being told Epstein was a priority to check on that night, nor did he recall officers walking up to the tiers around 9:20pm or 10:30pm.
The interview was conducted under a proffer agreement, indicating the employee was providing information possibly in exchange for limited immunity.
